description: From Spanish renegado, from Medieval Latin renegātus, perfect participle of renegō (“I deny”). See also renege.

entries.meaning: A disloyal person who betrays or deserts a cause, religion, political party, friend, etc.

verbs.description: renegade (third-person singular simple present renegades, present participle renegading, simple past and past participle renegaded)

entries.meaning: (dated) To desert one's cause, or change one's loyalties; to commit betrayal.
examples: The recent arrangement, obtained by Lord Stratford, as to the case of a Christian renegading to Mohammedanism  […]
